author: terencechain
content: I want to clarify the language here for verifying a gossip'ed block

author: terencechain
content: > The proposer signature, signed_beacon_block.signature, is valid

author: terencechain
content: The proposer index is not in play right? (ie it doesn't have to be the correct proposer index corresponding to the slot of the block)

author: djrtwo
content:
we've added a  condition in `v011x` to be released asap. first, we check that the proposer index is correct wrt expected shuffling (and if we can't immediately tell, we MAY queue the block as we go calculate shuffling)

https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/v011x/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#global-topics

author: terencechain
content: Ahh ok thanks. I thought that was weird. Glad I asked

author: djrtwo
content: This ensures that we don't have a size N-1 DoS vector at each slot (for non-assigned proposers)

author: paulhauner
content:
> we've added a  condition in `v011x` to be released asap. first, we check that the proposer index is correct wrt expected shuffling (and if we can't immediately tell, we MAY queue the block as we go calculate shuffling)
> 
> https://github.com/ethereum/eth2.0-specs/blob/v011x/specs/phase0/p2p-interface.md#global-topics
<@!291925846556540928> I would have thought it sensible to verify the signature, _then_ verify that the proposer index is correct for the shuffling. That way we're protected against random people (i.e., not deposited validators) from causing us to load some obscure state from disk and process a bunch of skip slots.
